message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get your hands on something truly valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $75. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $75. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $82.50. It's a fair price considering the value this product can bring to you.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. Would you be willing to go down to $80?

I understand your hesitation, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll offer it to you for $81.50. It's the lowest I'm willing to go, considering the value this product holds. I hope you can meet me at this price.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still not sure this is the right price for me. Would you be willing to go down to $79?

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll offer it to you for $80.50. This is the last time I can make a concession, so I hope you can meet me at this price.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still not sure this is the right price for me. Would you be willing to go down to $78?

I've made it clear that I'm not willing to go below $80. I'm not going to make any more concessions. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $80, or I can sell it to John for $80. The choice is yours.
